results.title: What are the odds?
results.brief_description: Introduces some ideas relation to probability, and presents situations designed to explore random events and the frequency distribution of probability. From the series Vision in mathematics.

results.title: What are cells?
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Living Cell”.
To introduce this film the concept of cellular organization of plants and animals is examined and the main parts of a cell are identified. The diversity of cells within a single organism is illustrated. A brief history of microscopy shows how improvements in instrument made possible the formulation of the cell theory. An animated sequence demonstrates the process of mitotic nuclear division in an animal cell and the film end s by showing the major differences between plant and animals cells.

results.title: What am I bid for the tree?
results.creator_credit: Oldfield and Sons and Barrie Oldfield
results.brief_description: A satirical approach to the value of trees. Actor, James Bailey, by taking on various guises - teacher, philosopher, auctioneer, architect - tries to inform an uninterested audience of the many uses of the tree. Filmed at Wungong Brook, Western Australia - a film for Arbor Day. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: What about us
results.brief_description: The film shows a Swedish school class in which the children are all between nine and ten years old. The children give us their view on changes taking place in our environment.

results.title: What about tomorrow?
results.creator_credit: A Dave Smallin Production and Dave Smallin
results.brief_description: The consumption of alcohol by adolescents is the subject of this dramatized open-ended film. The influences upon teenagers to take up drinking are indicated and one young man is confronted with the possible long term effects of alcohol misuse.

results.title: What about me?: young people and local government
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions, Ivan Gaal and Jeff Spencer

results.title: What about juvenile delinquency?
results.creator_credit: Centron Production and Young America Films
results.brief_description: A gang of high school delinquents discover that the man they assaulted was the father of Jamie, one of their gang members. When Jamie learns the truth about the incident, he joins forces with the ‘good’ students to combat juvenile delinquency. A social guidance film intended to trigger classroom discussion in American school students.

results.title: What about I.F.C?
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Arch Nicholson
results.brief_description: Comparison with another firm in the same business and of approximately the same size can be of immense value to management in evaluating their own firm’s performance. The film is directed at management of firms from the smallest grocer to the largest corporation and is designed to show the advantages of I.F.C. The film is directed at small firms and large corporations.

results.title: What's your authority?
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Gregory Heimer
results.brief_description: Presents two episodes involving children confronting the problems of authority. Examines the kinds of authority found in our society and the individual’s relation to authority. Produced by Greg Heimer in collaboration with Lawrence Kohlberg, Phd. Harvard.
